name: compressible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be pressed into a smaller space: compressible gas Because plastic bags are light and compressible, they constitute only 2 percent of landfill.
(of a computer file) able to be made to use less space when it is stored in the memory of a computer or on a disk, by using a special program: Files are compressible in some applications, which saves memory. The degree to which the data is compressible depends on how many repeating patterns the data has.
More examplesFewer examplesWater is far less compressible than air.Hot dogs are the biggest choking culprits because they are cylindrical, compressible, and about the size of a young child's airway.The polygon can be encoded in a digital, compact, compressible formatBuilt in compression ensures that highly compressible files are stored efficiently.
